concise_definition: adj. / adv. 搞砸了, 被坑了, 处境糟糕的, 酒醉的

definitions.explanation_en: In a state of serious trouble or difficulty, often due to bad luck, poor decisions, or external circumstances beyond one's control.
definitions.explanation_cn: 处于严重困境或麻烦中，通常由于运气差、错误决定或无法控制的外部情况所致。
definitions.example_en: I forgot to pay my rent—now I'm completely screwed.
definitions.example_cn: 我忘了交房租，现在彻底完蛋了。

definitions.explanation_en: Damaged, broken, or malfunctioning, especially due to improper use or poor quality.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因使用不当或质量低劣而损坏、失灵的。
definitions.example_en: The car's transmission is screwed—no point trying to fix it.
definitions.example_cn: 这辆车的变速箱坏了，修也没用。

definitions.explanation_en: Intoxicated or drunk, especially in a disoriented or uncontrolled way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 喝醉的，尤指处于神志不清或失控状态。
definitions.example_en: He got totally screwed at the party and passed out on the couch.
definitions.example_cn: 他在派对上喝得烂醉，倒在沙发上睡着了。

definitions.explanation_en: Used informally to emphasize that something has gone wrong or failed completely.
definitions.explanation_cn: 非正式用法，强调某事彻底搞砸或失败了。
definitions.example_cn: 我们错过了航班——又搞砸了！

comparison.analysis: “Ruined” (毁掉的) 强调永久性或严重性的破坏，常用于物质、声誉或机会的彻底毁灭，语气更正式、更沉重。而 “screwed” 更口语化，常用于日常抱怨，不一定意味着不可逆转的后果。
“Fucked” 是 “screwed” 的更粗俗版本，语义高度重叠，但语气更强烈、更具攻击性或情绪化。在正式或中性语境中，“screwed” 是更可接受的替代词，而 “fucked” 通常被视为冒犯性语言。
“Messed up” (搞砸了) 与 “screwed” 意义接近，但语气更轻松、更口语化，常用于轻微错误或小麻烦，而 “screwed” 更倾向于表达严重后果或绝望处境。例如：‘I messed up my homework’（我作业搞砸了）vs. ‘I’m screwed—I failed the exam’（我完蛋了——考试没过）。
